meanings.definition: To look at someone in a way that shows sexual attraction or desire.
meanings.sent1: She ogled him from across the room, unable to hide her attraction.
meanings.sent2: The man ogled the woman as she walked by, making her uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: He ogled her so obviously that it made everyone around them chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes ogled him like he was the most captivating person in the room.
meanings.sent5: The way he ogled her made her feel like the most desired person in the world.

meanings.definition: To stare at someone in a way that is considered impolite or rude.
meanings.sent1: The teacher scolded the student for ogling out of the window during class.
meanings.sent2: She felt uncomfortable as the stranger ogled her while waiting for the bus.
meanings.sent3: He ogled the painting in the museum for so long that the security guard had to intervene.
meanings.sent4: The cat ogled the bird outside the window, longing to catch it.
meanings.sent5: The way he ogled the expensive car parked on the street made the owner nervous.
